description: Formation of 3 no. parking spaces at land to the rear of Pelham Court
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in strict accordance with the construction detailS shown on drawing number 2355-P01 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To protect the health of nearby trees in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 6 (Construction Management Plan) of planing permission 19/01980/FUL are hereby approved.

The Council's Neighbourhood Traffic Engineer is satisfied with the information provided in relation to Condition 9 (Construction Management Plan). As such, the details submitted by the applicant are considered satisfactory and Condition 9 of planning permission 17/16196/FUL is hereby approved.
Please confirm/amend the site location. The application form  states 6 Arnold Drive, Chessington,KT9 2GD, however the sketch plan states no.5.

Due to the effect that Covid-19 has had upon working procedures, the Tree Officer will not be carrying out site visits for the foreseeable future. As such, if you are making an application or notification for works to a protected tree please ensure that you or your agent provide clear photos of each tree and any key features you wish to draw to the attention of the Tree Officer to be considered. Photos should be labelled T.1, T.2 and so on, in order that they can be identified according to the list of works you have provided and the corresponding numbered plan showing the location of each tree. This will enable the Council to provide you with a decision in line with the standard processing times. If you do not provide this additional information then the Council may refuse your application on the basis of lack of supporting information.
Please confirm if this is to be used as a home office or if this building is to be used for commercial purposes
